content: I learned of this through a "Mega Vote" email. I did not even know it was being re-considered at this time. I have mixed feelings about it. DC was established as a Federal area that is apart and separate from the states, thus having no voice in voting for it's self. One one hand, why should the Federal government have a voice (vote) in how it does business? On the other, I realize the folks living there are being taxed without representation. Why has the media not brought attention to something that changes our founding documents before the vote? If they have, it sure wasn't in the spotlight.... Discuss:

title: DISTRICT OF COLUMBIA HOUSE VOTING RIGHTS ACT OF 2009
